Reviews.Title: “A WONDERFUL WEEKEND AT A WONDERFUL PLACE”
Reviews.Author: Danny L
Reviews.Content: I have to say that my stay over this past weekend was a true pleasure. First off Christine could not have been any friendly or more accommodating. She made me feel at home after a very tough trip in and that was only compounded by the fact that the room was clean and spacious, the free breakfast was excellent, and the value could not have been any better. I will absolutely stay here again and am very grateful for how wonderful things were during my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Disgusting, Avoid this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: BigMikeColorado
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't stay here again in a million years. This was one of the worst hotel experiences I have ever had. Here is why: *(This review is a bit long. I have tried to be comprehensive so that you can make your own educated decision not to stay at this hotel). First, this hotel was extremely dirty. The bathroom was dirty,the sink area had red stuff on the sink, wall, and on the hair dryer. The fact that it was on also on the hand towel but not a permanent stain led us to believe the towels had been not changed. Many things were just dirty or sticky. The bed was disgusting. It had brown stains running down the sides of the box spring, looked like vomit or blood. Honestly I didn't want to know. Second, the bed was very uncomfortable, there were only two pillows and no extra blankets. The blanket had lots of hair on it. No toiletries were provided, the TV wasn't hooked up to the cable and once I got it working it had lines running the picture. Internet was terribly slow. Third, the room had a bad smell and it sounded like water was dripping through the wall. Regulating the temperature was very difficult. The carpet and arm chair had stains. A few positives. The staff was polite when we checked in and the gentleman who was driving the shuttle van to the airport was friendly. *Given the fact that the circumstances of my stay were less than optimal, I have tried to be as objective as possible in my review. Bottom line. Don't stay here. Just don't. There are far better hotels in the vicinity for the same price. Safe travels! A secondary point--My wife and I stayed here the night before a 6 am flight since we live far from the airport. We wanted to take advantage of the park and ride service which allows you to park free at the hotel while you are gone. Upon arriving and inquiring about the shuttle, we found that it starts running at 4am and stops running at 10pm. They had changed it since the last time we had used the service and since our return flight came in at 10:30pm, we were forced to take a taxi back tot he airport. It seems a bit odd that the shuttle will start as early as 4 but stop at 10 but I guess I can't really complain about that, I could have checked that before I booked.

Reviews.Title: “Not very good”
Reviews.Author: bay192003
Reviews.Content: Hotel was somewhat dirty and rooms very dated. Elevator was broken most of time and breakfast was most limited have seen in quite a while. Nothing nearby in walking distance as hotel sits in warehouse area. Airport is close by. Would not stay again really needs some upgrading.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly clean, friendly, affordable airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: famdoc67
Reviews.Content: Our flight out of Indy was canceled and so we searched tripadvisor for a reasonably-priced airport hotel. This was the first we called, and we're glad we didn't call any others. We were cheerfully greeted on the phone, quoted an unbelievably low rate (lower than the usual rate on this property) and told where the free shuttle would meet us. Fifteen minutes later, we were given a clean, amply-sized room, free internet and cable TV and a cheerful staff. The swimming pool, which we did not use, was clean and well-maintained. No complaints, only praise for this hotel. Be aware: there are two Extended Stay properties near the airport: this is the one called "deluxe"

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: CATManTexas
Reviews.Content: Great location to get to all parts of city for insurance claims. Had smaller room which left much to be desired for office space, but otherwise GREAT staff, great COFFEE. If you can afford to upgrade get the bigger room.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Quite Acceptable, Not Noteworthy, Disappointing B'Fast”
Reviews.Author: NancyClareAtl
Reviews.Content: This room was packaged with a flight at a combined great value. It's near the airport. Lovely lobby, new carpet. I was expecting a regular hotel room, and was pleasantly surprised with the kitchenette (stove, full refrigerator, sink, microwave, dishes, glasses, etc.) Separate sitting room outside bedroom with table for either eating or working. Carpet and paint looks pretty new. Two TV's. Furniture a little scuffed, but not objectionable for a two-star. Matress very firm. Linens and towels basic. Kitchen and bathroom fixtures pretty worn and dated, if that type of thing matters to you. Front desk staff was prompt, helpful and polite, even printing out my Boarding Pass for me. Card key reader to outer door was broken, so had to walk around to the lobby in very, very cold weather. Main disappointment was the breakfast - maybe I've been spoiled by other chains, but the breakfast room was so large and newly done, I thought surely the food would be comparable. Otis Spunkmeyer packaged muffins, some oranges and apples were the total items. Plus side was a good choice of coffee and creamers, available all day. I wish I had allowed time to go out for breakfast. I wouldn't mind staying here again for a few days, particularly at this price, but wouldn't go out of my way, either. The other guests were very nice and polite. Free parking. Printer available.

Reviews.Title: “The staff was so helpful and pleasant.”
Reviews.Author: savering
Reviews.Content: The hotel was such a nice place to stay. The rooms were clean and updated. All the staff were very courteous and well trained. I would stay here again and recommend it to others. Illinois Traveler

Reviews.Title: “Run Down!”
Reviews.Author: AAzz44
Reviews.Content: I had to stay in Indianapolis for 6 weeks before transfering out with my job. I needed a place with a kitchen and thought this would be a great place to stay and the price was right. Besides the really nice lobby, the room I was in was an absolute dump. Old. Smelled old, the bed was hard, pillows sucked....carpet was old and dirty. Needless to say I checked out the following morning and I will never go back. I actually steer clear from all other Extended Stays now due to this experience. Holiday Inns are a lot nicer than this place!

Reviews.Title: “Great value. Friendly staff. Convenient to airport and I-465.”
Reviews.Author: Dunwoodymom
Reviews.Content: My son found this hotel when searching for an apartment to rent for a summer internship. No apartments to be found who were willing to sign such a short-term lease. The weekly rate was very reasonable for an efficiency with a queen-size bed, so he booked a second room - 1 bedroom King for his parents for two nights, so we could help him settle in. For the price, I anticipated that the hotel would be rather worn and perhaps "scary", but I was pleasantly surprised. The lobby area was clean and well-lit. The front desk staff was friendly and very helpful with suggestions for where to eat, buy groceries, etc. The breakfast was light- packaged muffins, whole fruit, coffee and juice- but good quality. The rooms were clean, but furniture and carpet were worn- not surprising at this price point. The other guests seemed to include a church youth group (very polite), many temporary workers who went to bed early and left early in the morning, and some families on vacation. Although the walls are not particularly well-insulated, the other guests were very quiet, so noise was not a problem. The bed was very comfortable; mattress seemed new, and linens were clean. Pool was clean and pleasant. Fitness room small, but with good equipment- treadmill, stair climber. Guest laundry on-site. For about half the price of the newer extended stay hotels, I would say it is an excellent value. Nice to have the extra room and the ability to fix snacks or a light lunch or dinner in the kitchenette.

Reviews.Title: “Steer Clear of This Dump”
Reviews.Author: NapaSteveV
Reviews.Content: I booked a room several months in advance at this property for the Indy 500 weedend. First problem upon arrival was that the desk clerk tried to overcharge. Fortunately I had a reservation printout showing the agreed upon rate. The deal-breaker problem was that the room was swealtering hot with broken AC - unlivable on this 95 degree day - and no other rooms were available. Things went downhill fast when the teenaged solo deskclerk contacted property manager, Michelle Mouser, by phone and allowed me to speak to her. After whining to me about her current physical ailments, Ms. Mouser volunteered her overwhelmed desk clerk to find alternative accomodations for us. The result was a smoking room with one bed. Thank you very little. After making literally dozens of phone calls my son and I were finally able to secure a room at the Hilton Garden Inn, paying almost triple what I had agreed to pay for the Extended Stay Deluxe accomodations, but at least we had livable conditions and were able to enjoy the 500. BTW, I also had tix to the night before the 500 races at IRP and we couldn't go due to having to the mess created by Extended Stay Deluxe. The Extended Stay property manager, Ms. Michelle Mouser, demonstrated her complete incompetance in handling this situation and Rachel, the pathetic child she left in charge of the hotel on arguably the busiest weekend of the year, appeared incapable of managing her own Facebook page, nevermind an entire hotel. Mr. Jeff Orme, presumably Area or District manager, you and your staff owe my son and I a tremendous apology, and you sir, have a big problem with the staff at this establishment. May I assure you, I will never consider visiting another Extended Stay property in the future, and I hope this review will steer others potential customers away from your dump.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service: A smile cures all woes”
Reviews.Author: Indyfanforever
Reviews.Content: We ended up at Extended Stay Deluxe Hotel by happenstance. We were in town for the Indy 500. Sleep Inn Airport had canceled our confirmed reservations and didn't tell us until we got there. No apology of any sort. Sleep Inn sent us to Days Hotel, but at 5 am on race day, our room leaked water from the ceiling and the lights shorted out. Scary. We were already unhappy because Sleep Inn sent us to Days Hotel (same owner)-- and staff's response at Days Hotel was "This is not our problem." One employee, who called herself "management" at Days, actually argued with us when we had the nerve to voice our complaints. This happened every time we talked to her. Atrocious. Rude. Unbelievable. My husband noticed that there was an Extended Stay Deluxe Hotel nearby. Luckily, after the race, many people checked out of their hotels, and Extended Stay Deluxe had a room for us. The person at the front desk at Extended Stay was friendly and helpful. She explained in advance that we would not be seeing housekeeping because of our short stay (no problem for us), but said if there was anything we needed, to let her know. The only thing we needed was a refill for a coffee packet. It was given to us with pleasure. What a difference from the first 2 motels. The front-desk person at Extended Stay was apologizing to us for things that weren't even Extended Stay's fault!!!! (She gave us directions to an ice-cream shop, but when we got there, they had just closed for the evening. We found another shop that was open). It was our own fault; we took our time getting there and it was after 10 pm by then. We cheerfully told her about our adventures and she apologized profusely!!!! We were cracking up-- she was apologizing, and it wasn't even her fault!!! (As opposed to the other 2 motels, where apparently the motel's mistakes are the customer's fault.) The front-desk person at Extended Stay had a big smile and helpful attitude every time we walked through the lobby. THAT is how you treat customers (instead of saying, "not my problem," "come back later," etc). It doesn't matter if it's a one-star motel or a five-star hotel; a smile is free, and it does wonders for the customer. Granted, we didn't have any problems at Extended Stay Deluxe, so I can't comment on how a problem would have been handled. However, it is a good sign in and of itself that there were no problems. The welcoming atmosphere at Extended Stay made us forget the disasters of the previous 24 hours at the other 2 motels. When we left for the airport at 4:30 am two days later, there was even some coffee and breakfast items in the complimentary-breakfast room--and breakfast wasn't officially even scheduled to start yet. Thank you, Extended Stay Deluxe, for salvaging our weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Scary”
Reviews.Author: turner1988
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because they were offering a single room for $59.99 and I usually like staying in "extended stay" types of hotels. But though I checked in around 3:00 they were "out of single rooms". Unlikely but I was tired and didn't feel like looking elsewhere. The hotel itself is tucked away in an odd place. It actually sits back behind some office buildings and across a weird parking lot so its easy to miss. But the weirdest thing about this hotel is that if feels like you're staying in government subsidized housing. Perhaps its the economy, but the clientele were a little scary. In fact, upon first entering the back of the hotel (where my room was and where I parked) and getting on the elevator, I was immediately hit with the smell of pot. And as I walked down the halls I heard yelling coming from several of the rooms. Later, after coming back from dinner, I noticed a police officer leaving the hotel and saw a strange man with a glare on his face sitting in the lobby. The lobby gives the impression of a normal hotel, but between the dirty carpets, old furniture, and questionable clientele, I felt like I had spent the night in the projects. I wouldn't recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: “Suited our needs for Final Four weekend”
Reviews.Author: TSUAGD
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was the closest to downtown Indianapolis that we could get during Final Four weekend. I also liked the idea that it was a suite with kitchenette. Because this is an extended stay property, there is limited staff on hand. There is no daily housekeeping service, but you can exchange towels at the front desk if necessary. The property is in an industrial area, so there is nothing within walking distance except a Waffle House, a gas station/convenience store and a Schlotsky's deli. There is a continental breakfast of sorts, mostly coffee juice, fresh fruit and some pre-packaged muffins. They call it a "gourmet coffee bar". Nice for a snack to get started. Overall impression of the room was that although it was clean, it is time for an upgrade to the entire room. The kitchenette has a refrigerator, two burner cooktop, dishwasher, mini microwave, and coffee maker. The dishes are old and need to be replaced, especially the cups. They were plastic and chipped from wear. The living area had a couch and one leather recliner. The couch upholstery and the carpet were both stained and worn which really made the entire room look old. The closet is just a niche in the wall- no enclosure. The bathroom is only big enough for the toilet and shower, so the sink and vanity are in the sleeping area. It was clean, but the grout and fixtures need a good scrubbing. On the plus side, the shower was very strong, the towels were newer and the tub area seemed to be recently renovated. We had two doubles which made the sleeping area very crowded. You could only get in on one side of each bed because one side was up against the wall, which made it very difficult to make the beds, even just to pull up the comforter. The sheets came off the edge of the bed every time I rolled over because the elastic was worn, but the pillows and sheets were clean and the bed was reasonably comfortable. Overall it was comfortable and suited our needs, but I would not want to stay here for more than a weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome value!”
Reviews.Author: lemann98
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an awesome value! The staff was courteous and friendly. The room was clean and well appointed for hotel at this price point. The only real noise was from the airport nearby but it wasn't too bothersome. We will definitely stay here again when we are in this area.

Reviews.Title: “OK for park and fly”
Reviews.Author: moses1969indiana
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the night before a early flight out and it was great for this. We left our car for a week free of charge and a shuttle took and picked us up from the airport. The early morning shuttle driver I did not get his name was wonderful. He could not have been more helpful. Not the best in the world but it served our purpose and the coffee and juice and danish,bagels and muffins were nice to have before we left. Thanks again to the early morning shuttle driver. Great job

Reviews.Title: “I never thought about overnight, but is is a better value than most other hotels/motels.”
Reviews.Author: DawnCincinnati
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. I never considered Extended Stay for overnight. It was so much nicer and convenient than other places. Having a kitchen made it easy to get a late night meal. It was convenient to where I was going and the personnel were extremely friendly and helpful. I am disabled and they accomodated meperfectly. The price was the best part of it all! You just don't get better than this. You can bet I will start checking them out before anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Good room great price.”
Reviews.Author: frank4766
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a home and having a place that was central to our house hunting efforts was vital. It's nice to have a room with kitchen appliances. The staff was very friendly. By the way there are extra pillows at the desk.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our needs”
Reviews.Author: ponchogrl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before an early flight out of IND. We got a good price on the hotel website thru their weekend specials, and an additonal ten dollars off for signing up for their email specials alerts. The hotel was easy to find off of Airport Expressway. Our room was clean, two tv's, two queen beds, a pull out sofa, full size refrigerator, nice size bathroom. We weren't there for long so I can't say much other than it suited our needs perfectly and was a good price. We did not partake of the breakfast, as we left on the 4:30 am shuttle. The shuttle drivers going to the airport, and picking up again when we returned were personable. We didn't have to wait long once we retrieved our luggage and called for the shuttle, and the driver drove us right to our car. I would definitely stay here again when I have the need to spend the night before flying out of Indy.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: Headlock00
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nice. The room was clean. Everything about the hotel screamed clean. The bathroom was fantastic (usually the worst part of a hotel room). There was a great show of pride throughout this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stop room brand new”
Reviews.Author: ackart
Reviews.Content: I got this near the airport and it was so close to my thrifty rental car as well. THe room was huge with 2 heater control units - full kitchen with a dishwasher and large bathroom. I got this on priceline and they gave me the handicap room. It looked brand new. Im not sure if the whole place is this new but the hallways looked it. There was even a continental breakfast with great coffee and a bagel. They told me they had shuttle service to the airport every half hour. THe location was less than one mile from the airport. With the esa it says the desk hours close at 10 am. I got in at 12 :15 am and luckily there was someone there. Not sure why. Also no shampoo in these esa places so bring your own and the vender machine only takes quarters- no dollars. Fantastic place would rate it a 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “Good for What we Needed”
Reviews.Author: CMH-JFK
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an Extended Stay Deluxe and not an Extended Stay America like it says here. Anyway, we checked in on a Friday evening at the end of March for an early flight out of Indy the next morning. We checked in around 9:15 p.m. Check-in was kind of long since I had to sign many papers which was a pain since it was late at night and I wanted to go to bed. I had requested a non-smoking room with two beds but instead got what seemed to be like a smoking room with only a queen bed. So I went back down and found out that they were sold out, but somehow the person at the front desk found an available room like the one I asked for. This time the room didn't smell of smoke but the hallway did. The room was pretty good for the $47 I paid for one night. It was fairly clean and newly renovated with the new Extended Stay Deluxe room like what is shown on the Extended Stay website. I got up at 4:10 and got ready to go to the airport. At 5 a.m. I went down to get some breakfast (Yes breakfast does start at 5 a.m. here on the weekends which is hard to believe). Breakfast didn't consist of much, but it didn't really matter for the price I paid. It was basically some bagels and juice. At 5:30 we got on their free shuttle to the airport which was very nice since they include two weeks of free parking at their hotel with a one night's stay. So instead of paying $45 for the week to park in a parking lot, I stayed here for a few bucks more and got a room and free parking. What more could you ask for? Overall for the same rate I would go back and do the same thing since it's basically the same price as parking your car in a lot for the week.

HotelInfo.Name: Extended Stay Deluxe Indianapolis-Airport-W Southern Ave
HotelInfo.Address: 5350 W Southern Ave, Indianapolis, IN 46241
